New Records: The Dodgers’ bullpen held the Padres to 22 scoreless innings in the NLDS, including a 19-inning streak without an extra-base hit.
Key Match Events: The bullpen’s dominant performance was a key turning point in the game, leading to a 2-0 lead and eventual victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Roberts decided to bring in the bullpen early, trusting their ability to maintain the lead despite a slim margin.
Post-Match Reflections: Roberts highlighted the bullpen’s strength and reliability in securing the win, emphasizing their critical role in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers achieved the longest scoreless streak in a playoff series in modern history, showcasing their dominant bullpen performance.
Others: The article extensively covers the Dodgers’ playoff run and their strategy in managing the game, specifically focusing on the bullpen’s impact.
